results.title: ACMI Animation Open Studios: three weekends in September and October 2007
results.creator_credit: Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Three animators - Dave Jones, Nick Hilligoss, Steve Piscopo - participated in three weekends over September and October 2007 in the ACMI Animation Open Studios (as part of Pixar) sharing their secrets with people of all ages. Using a combination of moving image, stills and animation to a music soundtrack, this is a record of what took place.

results.title: Polo
results.brief_description:
Do nightmares come true? In a tale of a dark strange land, a silent outcast and a powerful robot, a creator will try to harness his creation.
Music by James Hodsons.

results.title: A Memoir of the Bunurongs
results.brief_description: A brief memoir recording the sights, sounds and essence of Sorrento, a small seaside town nestled in between Portsea and Blairgowrie on the Mornington Peninsula. Evocative images are accompanied by a music soundtrack and text (in English).

results.title: One another
results.brief_description:
Two protagonists search for themselves/each other within morphing boundaries and shifting skies.
Charcoal drawing on erasure stop frame animation with live action video.
Music composed by Joseph Tawadros and performed by Joseph Tawadros, James Tawadros and Ben Rodgers.

results.title: NOISE on film: noise for Darfur = Why should Australians make noise for Darfur?
results.creator_credit: Darfur Australia Network and Infinite Films
results.brief_description:
This documentary has been produced to raise awareness about the continuing tragedy in the Darfur region of Western Sudan and build solidarity between the Australian people and the people of Darfur.
The conflict in Darfur has been continuing for more than three years, has resulted in the deaths of more than 400,000 civilians, the displacement of at least 2.5 million people and there are currently 3.5 million people dependent upon insufficient international humanitarian aid. Darfur is in crisis and the genocide has to stop.
The film includes footage from refugee camps in Darfur, artwork and music from a range of local artists, and the perceptions of a range of influential Australians as to why Australians should make NOISE for Darfur.
results.title_for_label: NOISE on film: noise for Darfur = Why should Australians make noise for Darfur?

results.title: A Short portrait of Dennis Spiteri
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Jarrod Factor

results.brief_description: A social commentary on the environment in the year 3000 with a look back into the past and what used to be before the thoughtless destruction by humanity of the earth’s forests. 3-D computer animation with music soundtrack - no commentary.
